titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Douglas Ensminger Papers
titlestmt.author: compiled by Staff of Manuscripts and Archives

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Wednesday March 13, 2019 at 07:12

did.unittitle: Douglas Ensminger papers

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The papers consist of oral history transcripts, 1971-1972, covering Ensminger's years in India, 1951-1970, as representative for the Ford Foundation. The papers also include unpublished reports and memos concerning India, 1952-1982.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Douglas Ensminger Papers. Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged in three series and one addition (Unpublished India Reports and Memos): I. Topics Related to Non-Project Areas. II. Topics Related to Specific Projects. III. Programs in Pakistan and Nepal.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The papers consist of oral history transcripts, 1971-1972, covering Ensminger's years in India, 1951-1970, as representative for the Ford Foundation. The papers also include unpublished reports and memos concerning India, 1952-1982.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright status for collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.
